sentence.Network_en: He felt too miserable and lethargic to get dressed.
sentence.Network_cn: 他心情低落，无精打采，完全没有心思穿衣整装。

sentence.Network_en: It'served to make him rebellious and hence lethargic at times.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种情况引起他对现状的反抗心理,有时候便老是没精打采.

sentence.Network_en: It made us all lethargic before we had gone far.
sentence.Network_cn: 行不多远,大伙儿都意兴索然.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Latin from Greek lēthargikos, from lēthargos 'forgetful'

entry.tran: 慵懒的；没精打采的；懒洋洋的
entry.def: If you are lethargic, you do not have much energy or enthusiasm.
